content.description: Pull a small roof on good pockets, then finish out the hanging stembox.
content.location: Just left of the window on the "turtle" boulder. Lmk if you've got a different name for this

content.description: Stand start two high pockets. The left pocket is shallow and the right one is a deep two finger pocket. Work up to the bulge, mantle and scramble to the left to top out in order to avoid poison oak.I am assuming the route has been done before since it is clean with bolts at the top. Let me know if you have any info. There is definitely a lower start on the face and an even lower start in the cave that someone has been working on.
content.location: South facing slab on the Turtle boulder.

content.description: Sit start in the groove at the base of the overhang and climb up on pockets to join the slab. A knee scum might come in handy at the start.
content.protection: A few pads for comfort. The hard part's down low but you wouldn't want to fall off the "easy" slab.

content.description: Stand start with a left facing edge and a high two finger pocket. Work up and left using edges and small pockets, Mantle onto the ledge and scramble to the top. Top out left to avoid poison oak. There are bolts at the top but I did not inspect them or use them.I am assuming people have climbed this since it was already cleaned and there were bolts at the top.There is potential for a much harder sit start.
content.location: This route is on the south face of the Turtle boulder.

content.description: Start low on the arete under what looks kind of like a flipper of the turtle on decent pockets. Climb out the small roof and up the arete on mostly good holds but tricky feet. Fun!
content.location: Left of and below the start of "Turtley". If looking into the hole and the big prow that might be the turtle's head, the flipper is uphill to the left. Start low on the arete

content.description: Mind blowing feature. Climb off a pedestal and through the window on good pockets. Not grovelly or anything, just mantle through the portal and into another world. If you have a different name for this feel free to comment. Thanks everyone for the monumental cleaning effort on this boulder
content.protection: Awkward to pad with the flake/ledge.
content.location: The easiest line to the window, on the large turtle shaped boulder

content.description: Low start to Fully Dosed. Start on the low left pocket and the obvious sloper at about 4 feet. Climb into the start of Fully Dosed. Adds a bit of difficulty and makes the top a bit more committing. There is a good edge that may break, but the moves still go without it. Only a little harder. Great climb!

Main line on the largest boulders face. Follows a tufa like feature and finishes with a large move from pockets to a good hold. Top out is a bit high but on decent holds. Stand start at the obvious jug at about 7 feet. There are definitely a few more lines that feed into this one.
content.location: Main line on front of the largest boulder.

content.description: East arete of the huge boulder with the hole in it. Stand start with right hand in a pocket jug and left hand on arete. Some cool movement leads to a big block. Top out left.
content.location: East arete of huge boulder with the hole in it.

content.description: The Largest House sized boulder in the area, It's turtle shaped and has the hole/window formation.
